result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert T. Sayles

records.addlTxt:
9:49 AM 
Defendant Robert T. Sayles in court, in custody.
Attorney J. Eric Olson in court for Robert T. Sayles.
Attorney Brendaliz Valdes in court for State of Wisconsin.
Court Reporter:  Jan Leibhan.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Defendant admits to prior convictions. 
Defendant entered a plea of Guilty to Ct 1-OWI 6th;
Found guilty by the court; Ct 2 was dismissed outright on State's motion. 
Federal firearms warning and voter ineligibility status given to the defendant. 
Presentence Investigation ordered. 
Bond revoked pending sentencing.
Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 13, 2023 at 01:30 pm.

09:14 AM
Defendant Robert T. Sayles appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson.  Defendant in custody.
Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.
Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time.
Matter set over, bond continued.
Status conference scheduled for October 31, 2022 at 09:45 am.

from de requesting charges info.
sent ct record, cr complaint, info.

Defendant, Robert T. Sayles, appeared with Attorney J. Eric Olson. Intern Alexis Sell with Attorney Daniel Alejandro Bernard Deida appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:    DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 09:00 am.  07-11-22 Correction to minutes:  DE was in custody for this proceeding/ jt

148PM   Assistant District Attorney Brenda Valdes appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody by Zoom and appeared in court w/ Attorney Eric Olson.   Clerk JT  Minutes:   Defendant requests preliminary hearing within 10 days; Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 7, 2022 at 10:00 am. Bond continued w/ same conditions (see bond entry). mi

Defendant Robert T. Sayles in court, in custody.  Attorney Sydney Elizabeth Star appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
From Pub Def, def. is eligible, no attorney assigned yet.

PROPER ATTIRE REQUIRED.  NO SHORTS OR TANK TOPS ALLOWED IN COURTROOM.

If released, Report to WCS by 11:00 the next business day; Submit to random UA's upon request.  Comply w/ all program requirements & provide all required information.
